questions.text: Calculate hepatic clearance of a drug with hepatic blood flow of 2000 ml/min and hepatic extraction ratio of 0.5. What is the hepatic blood flow extraction ratio?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1000ml per min Hepatic clearance = hepatic blood flow X hepatic extraction ratio = 2000 x 0.5 =1000ml/min

questions.text: A patient comes 6 hours after consuming morphine and presents with pinpoint pupils and respiratory depression. T ½ is 3 hours and the Volume of distribution is 200L. The plasma Concentration is 0.5 microgram/ml. Calculate the initial loading dose of the morphine.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

400 mg Vd = 200L T ½ = 3 hours Plasma concentration after 6 hrs = 0.5 microgram/ml T ½ = 3 hours, So Plasma concentration before 3 hrs = 1 microgram/ml T ½ = 3 hours, So Plasma concentration at the time of consumption = 2 microgram/ml = 2mg/L So, applying the formula Loading dose = Vd x plasma concentration ( at time of consumption of morphine) = 200 x 2 = 400 mg

questions.text: Which of the following acts through tyrosine kinase type receptor?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Insulin-like growth factor

Highyeild:

Salbutamol acts on the Beta receptor which is a GPCR Cetrizine acts on the H2 receptor which is a GPCR Spironolactone acts on the Aldosterone receptor which is a nuclear receptor Insulin-like growth factor acts through tyrosine kinase type receptor The commonest protein kinases are the ones that phosphorylate tyrosine residues on the substrate proteins and are called ‘receptor tyrosine kinases (RTKs) Examples are—insulin, epidermal growth factor (EGF), nerve growth factor (NGF), and many other growth factor receptors. Inhibitors of specific RTKs involved in growth factor signaling are a new class of targeted anticancer drugs

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Salbutamol belongs to a group of medicines called fast-acting bronchodilators or “relievers”. It’s used to treat the symptoms of asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary diseases (COPD) such as coughing, wheezing, and breathlessness. Option: B. Cetirizine is a second-generation antihistamine used to treat allergic rhinitis (hay fever), dermatitis, and urticaria (hives). It is taken by mouth. Effects generally begin within thirty minutes and last for about a day. Option: C. Spironolactone is a medicine known as a diuretic (water pill). It is mainly used in the treatment of heart failure and high blood pressure. It is also used to reduce swelling (edema) caused by some other conditions and to treat people with low levels of a mineral called potassium

questions.text: Which is the best way to manage a patient with aspirin poisoning?

options.label: B
options.text: Make urine acidic with Ammonium chloride

questions.correct_answer: A. Make urine alkaline with NaHCO3
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Make urine alkaline with NaHCO3

Highyeild:

Acidic drugs are ionized more in alkaline urine, so Aspirin is a weakly acidic drug, so to make it ionized, the drug has to be placed in alkaline media. So make the urine alkaline with NaHCO3 Acidic drugs are ionized more in alkaline urine—do not back diffuse in the kidney tubules and are excreted faster. Accordingly, basic drugs are excreted faster if urine is acidified

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: C . Treat with N acetylcysteine: no such role in aspirin poisonings. Option: D. gastric lavage is not indicated in aspirin poisoning.

questions.text: Among the following statements, which one is false about first-order kinetics is:

options.label: A
options.text: Constant fraction of drug eliminated in unit time

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Elimination rate is constant

Highyeild:

First order kinetics Constant fraction of drug is eliminated per unit time Rate of elimination is variable and directly proportional to plasma concentration. at high drug concentration elimination rate increases and at low drug concentration elimination rate decreases Clearance remains constant Half life remains constant.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Constant fraction of drug eliminated in unit time is according to first order. Option: B. Half-life is constant for first order Option: C . Clearance is constant for the first order.

questions.text: A lactating mother came to the OPD with complaints of urinary tract infection. The doctor prescribed an antibiotic for her condition. Which of the following is preferred for a lactating mother? Giving short-acting drugs Systemic drugs are preferred over topical drugs Just before the next dose breastfeed Breastfeed the baby immediately after drug intake
questions.explanation:
Solution:

I, III

Highyeild:

For a lactating mother, the following are preferred while prescribing drugs Short-acting drugs Local/topical drugs Advise feeding the baby just before the next dose because the drug concentration will decrease. Advise not to feed the baby after taking the drug Systemic drugs are given with caution as they can affect the baby by passing through breast milk I) Giving short-acting drugs is the correct statement. II) Systemic drugs are preferred to topical drugs and are usually avoided. III) Just before the next dose breastfeeding is usually preferred. IV) Breastfeeding the baby immediately after drug intake is usually avoided.

questions.text: A 45-year-old male was suffering from deep vein thrombosis and the patient was on warfarin anticoagulation therapy. Warfarin undergoes mixed-order kinetic. Which of the following is TRUE regarding mixed-order kinetics?

options.label: A
options.text: At higher doses, the kinetics changes from first-order to zero-order kinetics

options.label: B
options.text: Plasma concentration increases with an increase in dose

options.label: C
options.text: Theophylline and phenytoin follow mixed-order kinetics

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above

Highyeild:

Mixed order kinetics Elimination of some drugs approaches saturation over the therapeutic range and kinetics changes from first-order to zero order As a result, plasma concentration increases disproportionately with an increase in dose Phenytoin, tolbutamide, theophylline, and warfarin follow mixed-order kinetics or nonlinear elimination

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . At higher doses, the kinetics changes from first-order to zero-order kinetics Option: B . Plasma concentration increases with an increase in dose Option: C . Theophylline and phenytoin follow mixed-order kinetics note: all are true statements.
